YAU.title: Yearly Active Users
YAU.description: The number of clients who used Firefox in the past 365 days.

MAU.title: Monthly Active Users
MAU.description: The number of clients who used Firefox in the past 28 days.

avg_daily_usage(hours).title: Daily Usage
avg_daily_usage(hours).description: The hours spent using the browser for a typical client. Globally, the typical user averages slightly over 5 hours of browser use per day, and this figure is crept slightly upward over 2017. Among the top 10 countries, Americans are the heaviest users, averaging over 7 hours of daily use at the beginning of 2018 while Italians come in last, averaging just under 3 hours of daily use.

avg_intensity.title: Average Intensity
avg_intensity.description: The engagement level of a typical client. Measures the proportion of a client's daily use where they actively engaged with the browser.

pct_new_user.title: New Users Percentage
pct_new_user.description: The percentage of clients who were new users.

pct_latest_version.title: Latest Version
pct_latest_version.description: The percentage of clients running the latest version of Firefox (for that week). Vertical lines represent Firefox release dates. Note, Firefox updates are often throttled at different rates (i.e. 10% of population in week 1, etc.).
